intro: Gilia mariposiana, commonly known as the Mariposa gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Gilia mariposiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
